page.title: 07BLAISDON COMMUNITY LIFE.
page.content: The annual parish meeting takes place in April. Each year has a theme, 1985 was {SECURITY.}The village hall,a dis-used school has recently been modernized. It is used for most village activities from W.I.to aerobics. Blaisdon also raises money for charity. The{plum festival}raised Â£2,000. There is a harvest sale too. Public transport is limited to one bus to Gloucester at 7.40 am returning at 6.15 daily with an extra one on Wednesdays.Luckily most people in Blaisdon have a car.Milk is delivered three times a week.There is no village shop or Post Office. It is interesting to see the contrast with Longhope. Blaisdon was dependent on the Hall. As a result it is now a pretty village but lacks the economic and commercial features of Longhope.
